emerging_technologies.name: AI-driven Smart Contracts
emerging_technologies.description: Smart contracts that can dynamically adjust terms based on AI analysis of external data and events.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances trust in contract execution, reduces legal disputes, but raises concerns about AI bias and accountability.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires legal frameworks to recognize AI decisions in contracts, widespread blockchain adoption.

emerging_technologies.name: Tokenized AI Models
emerging_technologies.description: AI models as tradable assets on blockchain, allowing for open market monetization and governance.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Democratizes AI development, but could lead to monopolies if not managed properly.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory acceptance of tokenized assets, technical infrastructure for model tokenization.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Autonomous Transport Networks
emerging_technologies.description: A network of self-driving vehicles governed by a decentralized protocol for optimal route and load management.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces urban congestion, but brings up issues of employment for drivers and privacy concerns.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Legislative support for autonomous vehicles, public trust in AI-driven transport systems.

emerging_technologies.name: Space Resource Tokenization
emerging_technologies.description: Digital tokens representing ownership or rights to use space resources like asteroids or lunar land.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could revolutionize space economics, but raises questions about extraterrestrial property rights.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: International agreements on space law, technological advancements in space mining.

mainstream_technologies.name: Blockchain-verified Autonomous Decisions
mainstream_technologies.description: Autonomous systems making decisions logged and verified on blockchain for transparency and accountability.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in sectors requiring high accountability like finance, insurance, and government services.

mainstream_technologies.name: Tokenized Energy Markets
mainstream_technologies.description: Energy trading platforms where renewable energy credits are tokenized, allowing for peer-to-peer energy trading.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Gaining traction in regions with supportive energy policies and a push towards sustainability.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards systems where governance is distributed through blockchain and DAOs.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes transparency, reduces central authority, but challenges traditional power structures.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increase in blockchain-based organizations, potential for new forms of democratic governance.

epoch_themes.description: Integration of AI with blockchain to enhance decision-making, contract enforcement, and data integrity.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Enhances automation and efficiency but requires new frameworks for AI ethics and security.
epoch_themes.global_trends: AI becoming a core component in blockchain ecosystems, driving innovation in various sectors.
